{"id":545718125,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"1 year, 4 months","timestamp":1630176899,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"200 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/545718125/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Sort Integers by The Power Value","memory":"50.1 MB","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    int getKth(int lo, int hi, int k) {\n        std::map<int, int> dp;\n        std::vector<std::pair<int, int>> aux;\n        for(int i = lo; i <= hi; i++)\n        {\n            aux.push_back({i, steps(dp, i)}); \n        }\n        \n        std::sort(aux.begin(), aux.end(), [](auto &p1, auto &p2){\n            if(p1.second == p2.second) return p1.first < p2.first;\n            return p1.second < p2.second;\n        });\n   \n        return aux[k - 1].first;\n    }\n    int steps(std::map<int, int> &dp, int n )\n    {\n        if(n == 1) return 0;\n        if(dp.find(n) != dp.end())\n        {\n            return dp[n];\n        }\n        \n        int res = 0;\n        if(n % 2 == 0)\n        {\n            res = 1 + steps(dp, n / 2);\n        }else\n        {\n            res = 1 + steps(dp, 3 * n + 1);\n        }\n        dp[n] = res;\n       \n        return res;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"sort-integers-by-the-power-value","has_notes":false,"notes":"","topic_tags":[]}
